events.name: 3D Printing Excellence with CATIA V5
events.description:
Learn how to 3D design an mechanical component using CATIA Advanced Surface capabilities. Learn from the live demonstration how you can apply advanced techniques to create high quality, aesthetically pleasing and geometrically accurate Surface 3D CAD data. 
Be intrigued on how 3D printing can improve and enhance your business workflow both in time compression and cost savings, and understand how you can translate a concept into a physical prototype within hours. 
Gain insights from experienced professionals on the latest in 3D printing application and various post-process methods in converting your prototype for actual end-use.  
Agenda 





Start 


End 


Agenda

0830

Lunch & Networking Session 


  




This seminar is catered towards engineers, designers and business owners of all levels in the Aerospace as well as Precision Engineering industry. Join us at this exclusive event and uncover the different applications of 3D printing for you. 
Speakers 
  




  
Stanley Leung 
Pre-Sales & Application Manager 
Stratasys Singapore Pte Ltd 
  


Stanley Leung is the Pre-sales & Application Manager of South Asia, responsible for the technical sales support across the region of South East Asia, Australia and India to ensure sustainable implementation of 3D printing to the field. 
Prior to joining Stratasys, Stanley worked for a distributor under Objet AP Ltd. as a project executive, which owns various 3D printers including SLS, SLA, Objet, Zcorp and MLS in a period of 1.5 years. This is the start of his printing career. 
Stanley joined Objet AP Ltd. in 2011 and assumed the position of a Pre-Sales & Application Engineer for regions of Korea, Taiwan & Japan.  With vast experience on prospect visiting, 3d printing solution consultation and new application implement to the fields, Stanley developed a high-level of expertise and know-how with all that is related to company’s products and in-depth understanding on benefit of implementing  3D printing solution to industries. 
After the merger of Stratasys & Objet in December 2012, Stanley has played an important role in conducting numerous product & application training sessions to new partners. His contribution to strengthen penetration of 3D printing in the field had been recognized by the company and was assigned to be the Pre-sales Manager of South Asia in May 2014. 
Stanley holds a Bachelor Degree in Material Engineering from the Hong Kong City University. 
  




  
Sean Looi 
General Manager 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 
  


Sean Looi is the General Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, the authorised distributor of Stratasys™ 3D printing systems and materials in Singapore, Vietnam and Indonesia. Creatz3D’s additive manufacturing solutions also includes Arcam™ for production of metal components as well as Materialise™ Rapid Prototyping Softwares. 
Despite majoring in MSc Finance, Sean’s passion in 3D printing opened the door of opportunity of distributing 3D printing technologies in 2007. His knowledge in various manufacturing practices placed him in favourable position to advice on advanced solutions for direct digital manufacturing. 
Sean’s accumulated technical experience with a variety of different 3D printing machines, technologies and applications, across all industry sectors, helped him to gain foresights into the macro economy of additive manufacturing potential. 
In return, Sean has been actively helping companies various sectors think more critically, innovate better to improve workflow and is highly respected in the local Additive Manufacturing committee. With over 6 years of experience in the industry, Sean is a regular invited keynote speaker in various local institutions and events. 
  




  
Sally Chuen 
Sales Manager, Singapore 
Creatz3D Pte Ltd. 


 Sally Chuen is the Sales Manager of Creatz3D Pte Ltd, an authorized distributor of Stratasys products in Singapore, Indonesia and Vietnam. She holds a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from the University of South Australia, as well as a background education in Chemical Process Technology. 
Sally’s 9 years of past sales experiences revolves around the distribution of equipment in the production and manufacturing industries. She further diversified her portfolio into various other industries following her inception into Creatz3D in 2012 to promote the adoption of Objet 3D Printers.   
In 2013, Sally took the company forward by driving the demand and adoption of additive manufacturing in Singapore. With her background and understanding of the market, Sally currently heads her sales team to advocate the applications of 3D Printing. 
Sally has vast knowledge in 3D printing technologies and their various applications, and she is no stranger to sharing her advices with audiences. 




  
Donald Koh 
Sales Director/Consultant 
TecMaven Group Pte Ltd 


Donald Koh is the Sales Director/Consultant with TecMaven Group Pte Ltd and has over 20 years of Technical Sales experience/knowledge across different Mechanical and Manufacturing software solutions.   
Previously a Mechanical/ Manufacturing Engineer, Donald has helped many companies across different industries with individual Mechanical and Manufacturing requirement. 
Together with Keith Tan, Senior Application Engineer with 14 years of CATIA experience at Tecmaven Group, they will be presenting the power of CATIA V5 Mechanical and Surface Design solution and as well as downstream application to 3D Printing. 




  
Who Should Attend 

3D CAD/CAM Designers
Automotive Engineers
Mechanical Engineers
Business Owners and Decision Makers

Terms and Conditions 

Online registration is required.
Each participant is allowed to order one (1) ticket only.
Registration closes on 3rd February 2015, or when seats are filled.
Organizers reserve the right to the final decision regarding all registration matters

Further information, contact Nigel at 9388 0512 to find out more. 
Alternatively, you can email info@creatz3d.com to inquire.

events.name: Easy OPC with Kepware (PM Session)
events.description:
Overview: 
With the rise of Internet of things (IoT), Engineers and IT practioners face a wide array of problems. 

A complicated environment where everyone speaks different tech language
Overloading of field devices causing data loss, timeouts
Cyber Security of control networks
Interoperating between Legacy and New Systems
Lock-in situations

More data, More sources, More problems
Suitable for: 
In this workshop, figure out how the automation and control industries are approaching this problem with Kepware. See for yourself and find out: 

What is OPC and its variants protocol
Why people choose Kepware as the platform for Industrial Communication
Connect to a device in 3 easy steps and datamine machine data

 
Trainer: 


Steve Lim | Sales Engineer | Allied Solutions | Certified Kepware Trainer
events.location: Allied Solutions (S) Pte Ltd, 23 New Industrial Rd, #07-06/07 Solstice Business Center, Singapore 536209

events.name: "Small Creative Entrepreneurs and the Space of New Economies: Rochor Case Study" @Urban Lab
events.description:
Entrepreneurs from the Rochor+ neighbourhood in Singapore engage in dialogues on the ground in this panel focused on the impact of small creative entrepreneurs in activating the social, economic and cultural life of centrally located urban neighbourhoods. 
FAQs 
1. What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
By public transport, the nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Please use Exit A and walk along Peck Seah Street.  
By car, you may park at the URA East Wing car park. Please use the lift to access the link bridge on the second floor. Follow the signs for Singapore City Gallery, and take the escalator to the first floor.    
2. Is my invitation transferrable? 
Yes, in the event that you are unable to attend you may nominate someone to take your place. Please kindly inform the organisers. 
3. Do I have to bring my printed invitation to the event? 
No, you do not need to bring your invitation to the event.
events.location: The URA Centre, Atrium, 45 Maxwell Road, Singapore 069118
events.group_name: Urban Redevelopment Authority and Singapore-ETH Centre

events.name: Friday Hacks #87 - Deep Learning
events.description: This week's topic will be on an introduction to deep learning and neural networks by Shawn Tan. See you there! Location: Seminar Room 3, Town Plaza, UTown (2nd floor, take the spiral staircase outside Koufu) Free pizza is served before the talks. Talk description If you've come across the term deep learning before and have been hearing about how we're going to get Skynet soon, this talk will let you in on a little bit more of the details: How it works, where it's being used, the history of some of its development in the past, and why Elon Musk is horribly wrong about it killing us in the future ... the near future anyway. Speaker profile Shawn is an NUS Hackers alumnus, currently working as a research assistant in the NUS speech recognition group. He previously worked as a data janitor at Semantics3 in San Francisco. Our Sponsors Friday Hacks is sponsored by the NUS Enterprise Center and the Infocomm Development Authority. If you are looking to turn your ideas into a startup and would love some business support, feel free to get in touch with Jason from NUS Enterprise: jasontgw@nus.edu.sg

events.name: Manpower Hackathon
events.description:
Ministry of Manpower invites you to the Manpower Hackathon taking place from 6 to 8 February! If you are passionate about making an impact on local and foreign workers across Singapore, join us at the hackathon to demonstrate how you can help solve these challenges.   
Whether you are a developer or designer, researcher or entrepreneur, HR professional or safety and health expert, come, meet and work with other like-minded people at MOM’s first open innovation event.   
The themes you will be tackling at this hackathon are: improving engagement with workers; designing the Next Generation Work Pass; and driving excellence in Workplace Safety and Health. Want to learn more about the issues? Come to the Pre-Hackathon Workshop on Tuesday, 13 January to dive deep into the hackathon themes. 
  
PROGRAMME HIGHLIGHTS 
• Introduction to themes by MOM representatives 
• Panel discussion on the challenges and opportunities in worker engagement  - Dr Tan Lai Yong, Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy  - FAST (Foreign Domestic Worker Association for Social Support and Training) 
• Panel discussion on the challenges and opportunities in WSH and Risk Management - Seet Choh San, President, Singapore Institute of Safety Officers - Don Wilson Paua, WSHE Manager, Woh Hup - Lucy Tan, Chief HR Officer, Natsteel - Dr Goh Yang Miang, Assistant Professor, Department of Building, School of Design and Enviroment, NUS 
  
EVENT DETAILS 
Date: Friday to Sunday, 6 to 8 February 2015 
Time: 6.30 - 9pm (Fri) / 9am - 6pm (Sat) / 9am - 5.30pm (Sun) 
Venue: 237 South Bridge Road 
   
MORE INFORMATION 
Find out more about the Manpower Hackathon here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: TGIFHacks#28 - Engineering Culture at a Startup (Carousell)
events.description: Most would have heard of Etsy's "code as craft" engineering culture and also from well known startups such as Dropbox, Eventbrite and Facebook. But how is the engineering culture like during the early days of a startup? Hear from Victor Neo, the Lead Engineer at Carousell, about how having the right engineering culture is important right from the beginning. Speaker profile: During office hours (and late nights), Victor leads the Engineering team at Carousell and works primarily on the backend platform and infrastructure. Outside work, he serves as Python User Group Singapore's President, where he chairs the annual PyCon SG.
